newsitem.title: USA: US West Coast refined prods prices rise with NYMEX.
newsitem.headline: US West Coast refined prods prices rise with NYMEX.

text.p: Wholesale prices for U.S West Coast refined petroleum products edged higher Wednesday, tracking strength in energy futures in New York, traders said.

Trade was active for gasoline and distillates, as NYMEX (New York Mercantile Exchange) gasoline for July delivery rose 1.29 cents a gallon to $56.97 cents while crude oil for August firmed 49 cents a barrel to $19.52.
Offers on Los Angeles cleaner-burning CARB gasoline for July delivery rose 0.75 cents to 56 a gallon, traders said, with buyers seen at 55 cents.
Los Angeles CARB diesel, meanwhile, rose 0.50 cents a gallon to 58/59 cents a gallon.
